<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: import java.io.*;
import java.util.*;

public class SortTextFile {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
        BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("input.txt"));
        List<String> lines = new ArrayList<String>();
        String line;
        while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
            lines.add(line);
        }
        reader.close();
        Collections.sort(lines);
        BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("output.txt"));
        for (String l : lines) {
            writer.write(l);
            writer.newLine();
        }
        writer.close();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code reads all lines from the input file into a list, sorts the list, and then writes the sorted lines back to the output file. The sorting is done using the natural ordering of strings, which is lexicographic ordering. If you need a different sort order, you can provide a custom Comparator to the sort method.
